contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=February 2013}} '''Rodolphe Rubattel''' (September 4, 1896 - October 18, 1961), was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician. [[Image:Rodolphe Rubattel.gif|thumb|Rodolphe Rubattel]] He was elected to the [[Swiss Federal Council]] on December 11, 1947, and handed over office on December 31, 1954. He was affiliated to the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland|Free Democratic Party]]. During his time in office he held the [[Federal Department of Economic Affairs]]. He was [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] in 1954. {{start box}} {{succession box | before = [[Walther Stampfli]] | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1947–1954 | after = [[Paul Chaudet]]}} {{end box}} ==External links== *{{Swiss Federal Councillor|68}} *[http://www.dodis.ch/ Swiss Diplomatic Documents (DDS)] {{Swiss Presidents}} {{Authority control|VIAF=195039507}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Rubattel, Rodolphe | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swiss politician | DATE OF BIRTH = September 4, 1896 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = October 18, 1961 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rubattel, Rodolphe}} [[Category:1896 births]] [[Category:1961 deaths]] [[Category:People from Broye-Vully District]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] {{Switzerland-politician-stub}}
